intro: Rubus mathonnetii, commonly known as the Mathonnet’s blackberry, is a species of bramble native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Rubus genus within the Rosaceae family, characterized by its thorny stems and aggregate fruits. The plant typically grows in moist woodlands and thickets, thriving in partial shade. Its berries are small, dark purple to black, and have a tart flavor. The species is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and ecological significance.
